definition: to take care of one's family
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: My husband is a family-center man.
sentences.chinese: 我的丈夫是一個顧家的男人。

sentences.english: My grandfather was a firm man, very conservative, and completely devoted to his family.
sentences.chinese: 我爺爺是一位電影人，是一個傳統並且顧家的好男人。

sentences.english: My husband is a family-centered man.
sentences.chinese: 我的丈夫是個顧家的男人。

sentences.english: I am loyal to my family and I made a major decision.
sentences.chinese: 我很顧家，於是做了個重大決定。

sentences.english: I am a very family-oriented and traditional man.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個很顧家也很傳統的男人。

sentences.english: My grandmothers didn't do anything but keep house and serve everybody.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖母輩們都沒事可幹，除了顧家和當老媽子。

definition: hesitancy/indecision/to waver
intelligent/clever/bright/smart/acute (of sight and hearing)
honest/sincere/well-behaved/open and guileless/naive
to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
single-minded/concentrated
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
sense of responsibility
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to love dearly
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
motivation/ambition
home-loving/to feel a strong attachment to home life/to begrudge being away from home
considerate (of other people's needs)
a good wife and loving mother
